newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures end lower on weak technicals.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures end lower on weak technicals.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures ended a tad lower on Monday from its previous close on weak technicals, dealers said.
The benchmark Nikkei 225 September contract opened higher with Wall Street and the Chicago Mercantile Exchange and was given a boost to its intra-day high at 20,480 by stop-loss triggers.

Dealers said the contract eventually succumbed to lower levels due to weak technicals. After falling towards a crucial support level at 20,170, September rebounded to end at 20,255, five points off its close on Friday.
Dealers now pegged the next support level at 20,080-20,150.
The market was affected in the morning by rumours that ailing bank Credit Lyonnais was seeking help from the Bank of Japan and the Ministry of Finance.
But a ministry official said there was no move to bail out the bank now. Francois Pages, general manager at Credit Lyonnais Securities Japan, also dismissed the rumours.
